intro: Pseudorhipsalis amazonica subsp. amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian star cactus, is a species of cactus native to the rainforests of South America. It is characterized by its short, branching stems covered in dense, woolly white hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
